Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SJGAP (Skipjack tuna GAPDH-related AMP, natural AMPs; fish, marine animals, UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the N-terminal sequence of this peptide shows high similarity (97%) toYFGAP.Activity: Active against B. subtilis (MIC 3.9-5.7 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 26 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 9.7 ug/ml), S. iniae (MIC 4.8 ug/ml), Gram- A. hydrophila (MIC 25 ug/ml), E. coli D31 or ML35p or KCTC1116 (MIC 2.7-6.4 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa KCTC2004 (MIC 5.6 ug/ml), S. enterica KCTC2514 (MIC 2.0 ug/ml), S. flexneri KCTC2517 (MIC 1.8 ug/ml), S. sonnei KCTC2009 (MIC 1.8 ug/ml), V. parahaemolyticus (MECs, 3.1-12.0 ug/mL), and C. albicans (16 ug/ml). It is bacteriostatic rather than killing.Antimicrobial robustness: Activity is salt-sensitive: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (171-342 mM); NaCl-sensitive:B. subtilis (86-342 mM).Peptide stability: Activity is heat-stable.In vitro toxicity: fish RBC or human RBC: It showed essentially no hemo.lytic toxicity till 100 ug/ml.Updated 7/2021; 11/2024
Literature Information.Author: Seo JK, Lee MJ, Go HJ, Kim YJ, Park NG.2014
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial function of the GAPDH-related antimicrobial peptide in the skin of skipjack tuna, Katsuwonus pelamis
